result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles R. Branigan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(<=3g) [Modifiers: Repeater, Second and Subsequent Offense], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: 14CF834 and to any sentence currently being served.

superMiscConds.notes: Absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as recommended.
*AMENDED*
Deduct 25% of prison wages to satisfy financial debt owed for court ordered financial obligations.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Charles R. Branigan

records.addlTxt: w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Case called: 9:59 am
Includes 14CF834 and 14CF850.
Clerk: Kassidi
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo:
Defendant appears in custody and with Atty Wright Laufenberg;
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Counsel filed. State moves:
14CF834:
Ct. 2 (Possession on THC (2nd+ Offense)-Repeater)>>DRI.
Ct. 3 (Resisting or Obstructing an Officer-Repeater)>>DRI.
Ct. 4 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia-Repeater)>>DRI.
COURT GRANTS ABOVE. 

 
PLEA: 
14CF834:
Ct. 1 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Covert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine-Repeater)>>GUILTY.

14CF850:
Ct. 1 (Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine-Repeater-Second and Subsequent Offense)>>GUILTY.

Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  

COURT ORDERS: 
14CF834:
Ct. 1 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Covert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine-Repeater): 6 years WSPS - 3 years IC and 3 years ES, to run concurrent to each other and to any sentence currently being served. CONDITIONS: Assessment/treatment/counseling as recommended, Full time work/Full time school, Absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol, AODA and follow up, Court Costs. Eligible for programming. COURT FINDS 219 days credit, concurrent. 

14CF850:
Ct. 1 (Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine-Repeater-Second and Subsequent Offense): 6 years WSPS - 3 years IC and 3 years ES, to run concurrent to each other and to any sentence currently being served. CONDITIONS: Assessment/treatment/counseling as recommended, Full time work/Full time school, Absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol, AODA and follow up, Court Costs. Eligible for programming.
COURT FINDS 219 days credit, concurrent.

Case called: 9:26am. INCLUDES 14CF834, 14CF850. Clerk: Denise. State appears by ADA Kerri Puig. Deft appears in custody and by Atty Wright Laufenberg. Waiver of Prelim. filed in both files. Court questions deft as to waiver. Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made. COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial.  Information filed in both files.  Reading Waived. Plea:  NOT GUILTY to both files. Bond:  Continued. Atty Laufenberg moves for bond modification re: no contact with co defendants. Arguments by State. COURT orders bond amended that Defendant may have contact with co-defendants but cannot talk to co-defendants about this case. Adjourned: 9:29am.
